definition: to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: But a steam locomotive is a Shandong warrior.
sentences.chinese: 而蒸汽機車卻是山東綠林中的武士”。

sentences.english: An antique steam locomotive has been displaying at Nürnberg Eisenbahn Museum.
sentences.chinese: 展示於德國紐倫堡鐵路博物館中的古董蒸汽機車。

sentences.english: SL 357 was firing by burning wood.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽機車357號以木材爲燃料升火鳴笛。

sentences.english: The steam locomotives were superseded by diesel units.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽機車已被柴油內燃機車所取代。

sentences.english: Steam railways had their heyday in the 19th century .
sentences.chinese: 19世紀是蒸汽機車的全盛時期。

sentences.english: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 1941年，火車本可以由蒸汽機車拉動。

sentences.english: The 19th century was the heyday of steam railways.
sentences.chinese: 19世紀是蒸汽機車鼎盛的時代。

sentences.english: Some more models of steam locomotives of the early period.
sentences.chinese: 早起的蒸汽機車的模型。

sentences.english: Trains were pulled by steam-engines in the past.
sentences.chinese: 過去，火車是由蒸汽機車驅動的。

sentences.english: My son is crazy about steam-engines.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子對蒸汽機車着了迷。

sentences.english: In this way the rails were laid in the days of steam locomotives.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽機車時代的鐵路線路鋪設。
